intro: Caladenia excelsa, commonly known as the showy spider-orchid, is a striking member of the orchid family native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and vibrant, spider-like flowers that range in color from yellow to orange and red. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands. Caladenia excelsa is a perennial herb that produces a single, showy flower per stem, often with intricate markings that mimic the appearance of a spider. Due to its beauty and rarity, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
